result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM cases 22CM620, 22CF31, 21CF316, 22CF739 called. Defendant Stephen J. Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stephen J. Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to the doctor's findings that defendant is incompetent to proceed but likely to regain competence within statutory timeframe. 
Court finds there is probable cause to the crimes committed in 22CF31, 21CF316 and 22CF739 and finds defendant is incompetent to proceed but likely to regain competence within statutory timeframe.
Files to be indefinitely suspended. 
Clerk notes competency order and the findings of the doctor do not include 22CM620 and case won't be suspended. 
Parties ask the initial appearance in 22CM620 be adjourned until next hearing date.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Dr. Matthew Seipel, dated 08/15/2022
Status Conference, 07/14/2022
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF316, 22CF31, 22CF739 are called at 9:00 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Stephen J. Martin appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Stephen J. Martin.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates a new case (22CF739) and requests new return hearing to discuss all 3 cases. Defendant requests evaluation for mental health. State raises competency concerns based on Defendant's statements. Defense agrees with State's concerns. Court finds probable cause in all 3 cases. 
Competency Hearing: 08/19/2022 at 1:30 PM (IN PERSON).
Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions:
No contact with T.V.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/info.

ADDRESS INFO for Stephen J. Martin
Current: C/o DHS, 721 Oxford Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 3474 250th St, Cadott, WI 54727
SPD Appointment - Attorney Francis Rivard

Case called at 11:10 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Stephen J. Martin in custody via video from the jail with Attorney Rachel Robole. Attorney Fran Rivard appeared via video. Attorney Trenton Piltz court for State of Wisconsin. 
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Defendant instructed to contact the Public Defender's Officer to request Attorney Rivard be appointed.
RTN: 7/14/22 at 9:00 AM (Br 2).

Conditions:
No contact with T.V.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/info.

(12:15 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stephen J. Martin does not appear in court or via Zoom.
Bailiff notes the defendant is in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail on a PO Hold and will appear tomorrow.
Court notes the Initial Appearance is adjourned until tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
